I worry too much about how I may come off, any tips for that too?

     i personally don't like replies or the @ symbol in general, but looking around i might be the only one

     that hardly makes a difference. i spent a month during it learning new software anywa

5.11.19  12:22 pm   Hey Bill. My ladyfriend and I think your music is fantastic. How much live playing is in your music versus sequencing? I'm interested to understand your production process. 

     don't worry, i'll explain everything

5.11.19  12:12 pm   5.10.19  8:02 pm - Okay then, let me show you these words which will convey the virtues of albums. Me personally, I view albums as more like a book or a short story, where each track is a particularly memorable sentence from a chapter that sticks in your head, or a plot twist/intriguing moment or something like that. The whole purpose of an album in my opinion is to create a story that's bigger than just one song could provide, or rather tell one story but with a lot of nuance and detail to it. Instead of taking them on a short journey with one song and trying to pack as much as you can in there, with an album you can give yourself time to think and breathe and tell as much as needs telling and in the time it takes, y'know? Not tryna invalidate your approach to "musical storytelling", but that's the angle I tackle the music-making bull from, anyway.

     right, but if you're really gonna put any good amount of twists and turns in it, wouldn't it already be much more than an album?

5.11.19  11:11 am   what should you do if you're stuck in a bookshelf?

     loop select, expand selection, expand selection, expand selection, delete polygons

5.11.19  10:47 am   How an I make a catchy beat to a song? I have all the tools to make one, but I can't think of one.

5.11.19  9:43 am   hey, bill. i need to know, how do you make a schedule?

     you most throw seeds over the field every day for a hundred years or more until they lign up just the right way so then you spend the next 18 months worshipping that way

      what are your schedules like? what do you include in them? could you give me an example of one of your schedules? i'm desperate to know that. is that going to make me work more efficiently?

(sorry english is not my first language) 

     no, it's important to remember that the majority of the reality section takes place before i even knew how to make videos

5.11.19  12:58 am   How do you keep up your work ethic to work on so many projects like this as well as what's on your youtube channel?

     ethics are more fun if you let them go a little, so you can have the fun of getting them back

5.11.19  12:42 am   How do I access your latest reality videos I can only see those up to 2016 

     they are all there. the dates are according to when the content takes place. and there are other dates next to it which represent the date it was edited and assembled into a video. but so your head doesn't explode i only show the actual date the recordings are from and the other dates are invisible

     answer

     that's true

5.10.19  11:03 pm   how are you able to answer some of these questions with 4-second audio or video clips?

     i'm pretty good with computers

5.10.19  10:51 pm   do you think aliens are scared of us

     to them, we're the aliens

5.10.19  10:28 pm   This may seem like a stupidly obvious question, but is 'at the airport terminal' based on an actual experience you've had travelling overseas in a plane or is it something else?

     that particular song came to me after doing a series of domestic flights, with some change-overs. the first verse seems to reflect the feeling of an airport terminal during the course of a travel itinerary. and the rest of the song seems to represent the feelings of commercial airline travel in general

      I feel this song perfectly captures the surrealistic feeling of travelling to another country in a plane, like you've stepped into a special room for a whole day and when you step out again everything outside has changed. Really, I'm just writing this to gush about how much I love this song and your music, but yeah.

     that's nice of you.
